lines.content: * Entry point of the SplitLah application.
* Initializes SplitLah and starts interacting with the user.
/** Sets up the required objects for application.   */
/** Runs the program until it terminates.  */
/** Shows farewell message and exits the program. */
/** Reads the user input until the user enters the bye command.  */
* Represents a generic command that the user has entered into the application
* that can be run to produce a change or outcome.
* Runs the command with the information parsed from the user input, using the specified
* @param ui      A user interface to which the command will read its input from and print its output to.
* @param profile A Profile object from which Session, Activity and other objects are used to run
public abstract void run(TextUI ui, Profile profile);
* Takes in an error message as a String.
* Prints "Invalid command" followed by the error message.
public void run(TextUI ui, Profile profile) {
* Represents a session create command that the user has entered into the application
* that creates a session and stores into the profile object.
// Javadocs to be completed when implementing command.
public SessionCreateCommand(String sessionName, String[] personNames, LocalDate date) {
* Returns the session name stored for session creation.
* Returns an array of people's names stored for session creation.
* @return An array of String for people's name.
* Returns the date information stored for session creation.
* @return A date as a LocalDate object.
* Runs the command to create a session.
* @param ui      A user interface to which the command will read its input from and print its output to.
* @param profile A Profile object from which Session, Activity and other objects are used to run
public void run(TextUI ui, Profile profile) {
* Represents an Activity and its cost.
* Stores activityId and cost of the activity.
* @throws InvalidDataException if activityId or cost are negative.
public ActivityCost(int activityId, double cost) throws InvalidDataException {
throw new InvalidDataException("Activity ID cannot be negative.");
throw new InvalidDataException("Cost cannot be negative.");
* Constructs an ActivityCost object and sets cost to 0 if only activityId is supplied.
* Default constructor, sets activityId to -1 to avoid conflict with other activityIds.
* Represents a Profile for the SplitLah application.
* Constructor to create a profile object.
* Returns the list of session stored in the profile.
* Returns a new session id for session object to be created.
* a new session object is created without errors.
* @return The new session id as int.
* Returns a new activity id for activity object to be created.
* a new activity object is created without errors.
* @return The new activity id as int.

* Data-related errors (such as unexpected null objects) should throw
* Constructor that includes a message and an exception.

* @param message A descriptive message of the error as a string.
* @param cause   a Throwable to be stored in this exception.
* Constructor that includes a message only.
* Use this when no exception needs to be stored inside this one.
* @param message a String with a descriptive message.
* Default constructor. No message or exception will be stored.
